intro: Chuquiraga linearis, commonly known as the linear chuquiraga, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Argentina and Chile. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its slender, linear leaves and yellow flower heads make it distinctive in its native habitat. Chuquiraga linearis is often used in traditional medicine and is valued for its ornamental qualities.
